If one of your posts is deleted, does it still count towards your default title (Bottle Rocketeer, Spacecraft Engineer,etc.)? On a related note, is it possible to go down a title rank if some of your posts are deleted?

> 
> If one of your posts is deleted, does it still count towards your default title (Bottle Rocketeer, Spacecraft Engineer,etc.)? On a related note, is it possible to go down a title rank if some of your posts are deleted?

The forum takes into account all posts that are not physically removed. User deletes are known as soft-deletes, which hide them from view. Physically removing posts is rare, but erases all record of them. Forever.

So can I ban commenters? Pretty please? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

And, does approving or disapproving blog posts do anything?

> 
> So can I ban commenters? Pretty please? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

You can disallow commenting on individual entries. Banning commenters leads to hate. Best to leave the hate directed at us.

> 
> And, does approving or disapproving blog posts do anything?

Nope. Normally, approving a post moves it out of the moderation queue and unapproving it moves it back in. Since you don't have access to the queue, you also don't have permission to put anything on it.
